head.supplied: 27/5/94. ¶ ¶ Let me kindly know, dear Mr Deane, whether I sent you the information required for the new part of Mr Fitzgeralds Orchideous plants, or whether — as it occasionally happened I ¶ stopped...

div.p: No. 542, folder 28, series 4, MS 610 Deane family papers, National Library of Australia, Canberra.

Let me kindly know, dear Mr Deane, whether I sent you the information required for the new part of Mr Fitzgeralds Orchideous plants, or whether — as it occasionally happened I stopped
short
at the intention. The correspondence in my branch of the public service is so enormous (6000 letters in 1893) that I only get the strictly official letters copied, so I am not certain whether I carried out what you wished. My intentions to do so are always genuine, but in the overwhelming and multifarious engagements with quite inadequate aid, subjects may pass from my memory. If I am growing thus perhaps inattentive to you, kindly remind me by some few lines. Let me also know in some way the exact information needed. I suppose you want notes on the geographic range of particular species. I may not always have much to add, to what is published in the Flora, the Fragmenta and other works also on Australian orchids
